attributes.action: Provide funding for nature reserves in towns
attributes.background: Start funding for a plots of nature reserves inside towns, some parks could be used to help the population of our native insects, birds, hedgehogs and many other species that are being endangered. There should be no pesticides used.
attributes.additional_details: I want the Government to do this in towns also to help people, wild escape areas are proven to help people with mental health problems but can't get outside of towns. Children and schools will also benefit from visiting these places which are hard to reach by foot. All volunteers from every age or walks of life can help maintain pathways, planting and supervising the types of insects we are attracting, helping bring back endangered species. They should be open parks for all creatures to enjoy. Greener towns.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Add green infrastructure as a nationally significant project to the Planning Act
attributes.background: The Planning Act is heavily focused on infrastructure, such as road, rail and energy. We need legislation that enables conservation bodies (Environment Agency, Natural England) to apply for planning consent, including compulsory acquisition, for green infrastructure for the good of the nation.
attributes.additional_details: Green infrastructure is a planned network of natural and semi-natural spaces with other environmental features designed to deliver a range of ecosystem services. The Government should do this to promote importance of the UK environment and conservation in its national planning. At present, the legislation is centred around mitigation, when there should be a greater promotion of new green infrastructure. It should be up to the planning authority to determine whether there is a 'Case for the Scheme' in the interest to the public. Currently there is no mechanism for green infrastructure schemes to come forward and be assessed.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Adopt British Double Summer Time, and British Standard Time in winter
attributes.background:
This will help ordinary working people reduce their energy bills as it provides for longer useable daylight hours in the evening.

Historically British Double Summer Time has been implemented when there has been a need to conserve energy such as during WW2 and in 1973.
attributes.additional_details:
People are struggling with their energy bills.

By implementing this change to time we will have more natural light in the evenings and this will help to reduce energy costs as well as afford more opportunity for exercise and improvement in mental health.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Fund clean up of our seas from nuclear waste and ensure proper disposal
attributes.background: Over the decades the seas were used as a dumping ground for nuclear waste. This could have a devastating effect on the marine life and may forever alter biodiversity. We need to ensure that those barrels are salvaged and disposed safely.
attributes.additional_details: We need to correct the mistakes made the past. Mother Nature can only deal with so much and humanity has already had a devastating impact on the planet. We need to act now before the barrels full of the nuclear waste corrode and become part the food chain; let’s be the first country that takes responsibility and work in collaboration with other nations to achieve this goal.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the dissection of animals in schools, colleges and universities
attributes.background: Ban animal dissections from schools, colleges and universities. These could be replaced with; Computer programs, Videotapes, Slides, Books and manuals, Online virtual dissection kits.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only is animal dissection as old-fashioned as using an abacus—it can actually deter students from science.
 
Many animals used for dissection suffer greatly before being shipped to schools and used in a school lesson. Every year, millions of frogs are taken from their homes in the wild. Baby pigs are cut from their mothers’ wombs in slaughterhouses. Rabbits, mice, rats, and other small animals are bred in warehouses and never allowed to experience a happy or natural life. Instead, their whole lives are spent in cramped cages until it’s time to be killed for dissection.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Make it easier to end parental responsibility of absent parents
attributes.background: I believe the law should be changed to make it easier for caring parents to obtain sole custody over a child if the other parent has been absent for six years or more.
attributes.additional_details:
I have heard of examples where absent parents return to their children after a number of years. We raise our children with unconditional love and we naturally want to protect them from harm. Then a stranger is allowed by law to involve themselves in the child's life.
 
Please help change the law and help the caring parent and their children.

departments.name: Home Office

attributes.action: Remove/reduce VAT for low/mid-range personal mobile phones & mobile contracts
attributes.background:
Mobile phones are now essential. They're needed for many Government services (HMRC, Track & Trace, the NHS app); online credit card payments & other services.

The Government must recognise this by removing & reducing VAT on low/mid-range mobile phones and services.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government is requested to introduce VAT Tiers for airtime contracts & phones to recognise the essential nature of these products and to reduce the cost of these products and services to the consumer.

The proposed VAT tiers are set out below:

Tier 1: 0%. Contracts <£20/month. Phones <£200.
Tier 2: 5%. Contracts £20-£40/month. Phones £200-£500.
Tier 3: 20%. Contracts >£40/month. Phones >£500.

• Values raised yearly (greater of RPI & CPI).
• Top-ups lasting <6 months: zero-rated.
• Personal devices and contracts only.
• Bundles considered by component, not total.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Reduce the maximum working hours to 30 hours per week after Covid-19 lockdown
attributes.background: The Government should reduce the maximum number of working hours to 30 per week, with a view to better sharing out the work available and enhancing quality of life.
attributes.additional_details: This could help maintain the enhanced quality of life enjoyed by many during the lockdown: family time, health: time to walk, run or cycle, time to garden or be in nature, reduced work-related stress and increased happiness.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban private schools
attributes.background: Private schools should be nationalised and converted into state schools. I believe that private schools nurture class division. If we are a forward thinking nation, private schools should have no place in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Finland banned for-profit basic education. Since then, I believe Finland has seen huge societal improvements (naturally) given the levels of freely available education.
I believe that we are run by a class that perceives themselves to be better, together with an ability to buy their way through life.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Regulate and license equestrian livery yards
attributes.background: The Government should create a regulator for equestrian livery yards/stables which requires them to hold a license in order to operate. These licenses should be dependent on the conditions below.
attributes.additional_details:
Licensed livery yards should be required to:

- limit the number of horses/ponies per acre to a certain maximum; and

- offer all-year-round turnout for horses under welfare grounds as they are naturally grazing animals.

We believe this licence would improve the welfare of horses and ponies both mentally and physically, and bring in a large tax revenue for the government. Animals’ welfare must be paramount.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Go up not out and reuse existing buildings - ban all building on green space
attributes.background:
There must be no more using of green land for building.
Reuse existing buildings such as offices.
New build must be at least three storeys high  preferably more, with a communal garden.
attributes.additional_details:
Farmland and green spaces are being filled with housing at an alarming rate.
Whole areas are becoming unrecognisable and there is huge effect on wildlife and natural water control.
Building ever outwards is a luxury we can no longer afford. 
New build must be presumed to go up not out: like other countries with shortage of land we must start to build more homes on the same space with roof and community gardens.
The assumption that everyone will have a private garden can no longer be the case.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Amend legislation relating to dogs in the presence of livestock
attributes.background: I want the Government to make it a specific criminal offence for owners to let their dogs off a lead if near livestock, and to remove the legal defence for killing or injuring a dog if the defendant can prove they acted to protect their livestock.
attributes.additional_details:
If a dog causes damage to livestock, the owners should be charged and pay civil damages.
 
Existing legislation, including the Animals Act 1971, needs updating to reflect the views and attitudes towards all animals. Giving farmers a legal defence for killing or injuring dogs is disproportionate, when this is something that dogs are naturally inclined to do. The owners should be punished, not the dogs.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Legalise Natural Organic Reduction
attributes.background: Natural organic reduction - AKA human composting - is an ecologically friendly alternative to cremation. The deceased is covered in plant matter and then placed in a chamber to compost for 1-2 months. Afterwards, the compost can be used for growing plants. I would like the government to legalise it.
attributes.additional_details: Natural organic reduction is not natural burial - it is much faster (< 1yr, vs natural burial's 8-12yrs) and the nutrient-rich compost can be used anywhere. This could be of great benefit to areas in the UK where the soil has been depleted. It is also cleaner than machine cremation because it does not release ash and pollutants into the air whilst taking up a similar amount of land room. I also believe that people should have access to more funerary options, especially eco-friendly ones.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Florists should be classed as essential
attributes.background: I want the government to make florist shops essential.
attributes.additional_details:
Florists should be classed as an essential shop. With funerals still taking place around the UK, bereaved families still need bespoke funeral flowers. Whether this be a requirement of the deceased person stated in their Will or at the families request, this is their final goodbye and it should be carried out correctly. 

Funeral flowers are incredibly personal and arrangements of this nature need to be discussed in person. 

If garden centres are essential and are open to the public, surely a florist should be too.

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Add Locksmiths to the Key Workers List during COVID-19
attributes.background:
Locksmiths are currently not named on the government’s Key Workers list.
 
We believe locksmiths should be added to the Key Worker list during Coronavirus COVID-19, to enable them to respond to emergency situations for example where Care Homes or Hospitals may need a locksmith urgently.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the emergency nature of jobs a locksmith does, as well as the key support the profession provides to both Key worker categories as well as vulnerable individuals and emergency services, it is vital that locksmiths are able to travel to and perform their work without worrying about childcare requirements or any potential “lockdown”. 
 
Reasons why we believe locksmiths should be added to Key Workers list see here:
https://www.locksmiths.co.uk/locksmiths-key-workers-list-coronavirus/

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Increase funding for mental health support for all Emergency services
attributes.background: Invest more funding into mental health services for Emergency services to create the right service and support specific to their roles that are readably available through a simplistic process to access and use.
attributes.additional_details: Each section of the emergency services is met daily with different levels of traumatic experiences. Police routinely are attacked both physically and verbally, attend deaths of all nature, sexual assaults both adult and child. Serving personnel deal with traumatic experience over an operational period, whereas emergency services can spend an entire career dealing with traumatic experiences.  There is not enough support services readily available to support the emergency services.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Mandatory community service for litter droppers.
attributes.background: Issue automatic community service orders (in the form of street cleaning) to anyone caught littering.
attributes.additional_details: We witnessed a shocking increase in litter dropping by the general public in the Summer of 2020. The government must act now to prevent an even worse littering problem this summer. The answer is not more bins. Rubbish must be taken home if no bin is available. People must be taught that there is no excuse for littering, and the natural consequence must be that littering offenders are required by law to complete at least one week of community street cleaning service.

departments.name: Ministry of Justice

attributes.action: Fund research to find and protect northern white rhinos
attributes.background: I want the Government to fund research to identify and protect northern white rhinos in their natural habitats.
attributes.additional_details: As of March 2018, there were only 2 northern white rhinos left in the world, both in captivity and both female meaning they are functionally extinct, as the wild population was poached to near extinction. We need to help the governments of countries where northern white rhinos previously lived to research and find any existing animals and protect them to stop the northern white rhinos from becoming completely extinct.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Waive fees for UK citizenship applications for this year
attributes.background: Many families are in a tough time and are under severe economic pressure at this time of the pandemic. We want the government to waive the citizenship application fees for this year. The present fees for naturalization applications is £1330 per application so a family of 5 will pay £6650
attributes.additional_details: The applicants who are going to apply for British citizenship have to pay  £1330 per person for this and already people are having hard time meeting day to day expenses. We would like the government to show some compassion for the people who want to apply for the British naturalization and wave off the high fees for the applications this year.

departments.name: Home Office

attributes.action: Ban iguanas from being kept as house pets.
attributes.background: Ban iguanas from being kept as house pets. Of course they still could be kept in zoos or by licenced breeders but not as single house pets.
attributes.additional_details: Iguanas in captivity live 12-15 years at most while in the wild, they live 20 years or more. This is because they don’t thrive well in captivity and get ill easily because they don’t get the proper conditions and care they need. Many iguana-keepers don’t realise how big they grow up to (6ft) and don’t provide them conditions that seem like their natural habitat. Males in particular get aggressive as they get older. Zoos and certified breeders would get a check once in a while.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban production and sale of genetically modified crops and foods
attributes.background: The Government needs to ban genetically modified crops and foods.
attributes.additional_details:
There are too many allergies already in humans and the pollinators already have major problems.  
Once crops are in the fields they can be cross pollinated with natural crops and this could endanger us and the pollinators further.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: The Vegan Petition - Ban Animal Agriculture and Fishing by 2030
attributes.background:
Each year, 6.4 billion animals are killed and eaten by Britons. The slaughter of animals is the biggest massacre in history, and it’s happening right now.
 More and more Britons are going vegan. A switch to veganism for the UK could spare animals and help stop the climate crisis. It’s not too late!
attributes.additional_details:
Animals endure filthy and cruel living conditions in cages on factory farms, or equally cruel conditions on non-factory farms, painful mutilations, forcible impregnation, having their beloved babies taken away from them, hormone injections, unhealthy weight gain, and then electric stunning, gassing or shooting before slaughter at just a small fraction of their natural lifespan. 
 Animal agriculture is also ruining our planet!
 It’s time to put an end to animal agriculture and fishing!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

Your petition refers to a switch for veganism for the UK, but only calls for a ban on UK agriculture and fishing, not the import or sale of animal products. It's therefore not clear if you just want UK agriculture and fishing to be banned, or for all animal products to be banned in the UK.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Allow restaurant and hospitality workers to wear lash extensions.
attributes.background: Change health and safety audits to allow people to wear lashes who work in hospitality/ restaurants. These workers are paid minimum wage and work most evenings and weekends, spending long hours at work. They should be allowed to feel confident and beautiful as lashes don’t effect health and safety.
attributes.additional_details: The probability for lash extensions to fall out unprovoked are very low- they are attached to your natural lash and the only way they fall out is when your real lash falls out during your natural lash cycle. If anything, a false lash would be easier to identify as a foreign object. Lashes help improve mental health, confidence and self love, they should be allowed in the work place and do not object to any health and safety regulations.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

There are health and safety regulations about for handling food, but these do not specifically ban eyelash extensions. Decisions about detailed personal hygiene requirements are a matter for individual employers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You can read the Food Standards Agency guidance on personal hygiene here: https://www.food.gov.uk/business-guidance/personal-hygiene

attributes.action: Remove outdated 'Cestui Que Vie Act 1666' and assume people are alive not dead.
attributes.background: During the black plague and great fires of London, Parliament enacted Cestui Que Vie Act 1666.  I want the Government to acknowledge that the people born in the UK are living natural entities (until their real death) under God and do this by revoking the outdated act.
attributes.additional_details:
During black plague great fires of London, Parliament enacted the Cestui Que Vie Act 1666.
This subrogated the rights of men and women, meaning all were declared dead, lost at sea.
The Gov took custody of everybody and their property into a trust. The state became the trustee holding all titles to the people and property, until a living man comes back to reclaim those titles. The government have many systems that reveal a specific humans condition and so the time for assuming death is over.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

The presumption of death in the UK is governed by the Presumption of Death Act 2013. We could accept a petition calling for changes to how this legislation works, but it would need to be clear what changes you want.

You can find out more about presumption of death here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/sn04890/

attributes.action: CAROLUS III REX: Petition to Restore Full Latin Titles to the English Coinage.
attributes.background: The Royal Mint announced on 29 September designs for the new King's specie. They have been met with concern from coin collectors and Royal historians alike. The use of CHARLES III as opposed to CAROLUS III eviscerates 900 years of Britis numismatic tradition and add pig latin to the national coinage
attributes.additional_details: Restore the natural precedent of numismatic tradition. We are Caroleans! CAROLUS III REX DEI GRATIA FID DEF

rejection.details:
Coins are manufactured and issued by the Royal Mint, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You can find out more here: https://www.royalmint.com/discover/uk-coins/coin-design-and-specifications/.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 in the Midlands B46 area as it is causing local disruption.
attributes.background: Stop HS2 in the local area B42 Middlands.
attributes.additional_details:
The local people in the area want to stop HS2 works as it is destroying nature reserves, causing local description and vandalism. 
There are many road works, creating traffic congestion, noise pollution and ruining the landscape.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the impact of works to build HS2 in the Midlands B46, but it's not clear if you want HS2 to be rerouted or cancelled, or if you want something else to happen.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Cancel HS2: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621535

attributes.action: Allow Women to have temporary paid sick leave when suffering from Menstrual Pain
attributes.background: I believe I am speaking on behalf of all Women when I ask this of the Government: to allow women paid sick leave whilst suffering from menstrual pain.
attributes.additional_details:
For far too long, women across the Country (and quite possibly the Globe) have been expected to perform whilst at work despite being in agonising pain due to their Menstrual Cycle and Endometriosis. 
This is a natural monthly cycle that can cause excruciating physical pain and hormonal imbalances that often impacts those suffering with their daily activities, including going to work. More often than not, over the counter pain relief is not sufficient.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611719

attributes.action: Stop the plans for 6 3 bedroom properties being devolved on our green
attributes.background: Stop the plans from going ahead
attributes.additional_details: This area of natural beauty is the only area where children can play safely. This is a dog walking area. Building a road around the green would mean children will not be safe nor will animals that are in our community. This would cause a lot of problems for the people that are living around here.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action:
We DEMAND as electorates, that this is debated!

STOP SPRAYING OUR SKIES!
attributes.background: We demand to know truth about what is going on in our skies…what reasons can justify obstructing natural sunlight, photosynthesis and damage to all our health!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Reduce time to get settled status for Ukrainians holding long-term and ICT visas
attributes.background:
The government has already announced two new types of visas for Ukrainian refugees: 
1) Family scheme for settled UK residents (ILR/passport holders)
2) Local sponsorship scheme, with limited stay and no access to NHS
The proposal is to allow ICT visa holders to apply to the first scheme.
attributes.additional_details: UK is a home for a few thousand skilled Ukrainian professionals who came on corporate assignments and paid taxes to the UK for years. Despite being UK residents for many years, they are often holders of ICT visas, which do not count for naturalization purposes. Waiving this restriction and reducing the time required for settled status would allow them to apply for a Family scheme for their families to access the job market and NHS help for the wounded and elderly relatives.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to make changes to immigration rules for Ukrainians, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition refers to making it easier for Ukrainians on certain visas to gain settled status, but then says your petition is about giving Ukrainians on certain visas the right to access the Ukraine Family Scheme. We're therefore not sure what you want to happen.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Urgently recommence fracking.
attributes.background: Given the current and future problems with energy supplies before we reach net zero, fracking should be started immediately to take advantage of our vast reserves of natural gas. This would smooth out our transition from one power source to another.
attributes.additional_details: We are being mercilessly squeezed by Russia which is manipulating supplies of gas to Europe. Independence from this could easily be reached simply by relicensing fracking. Our own source of natural gas is a far greener option to importing it in tankers from around the world.

rejection.details:
You may like to sign the below petition we currently have open on this topic:

Commit to UK natural gas and increase investment
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608274

attributes.action: Allow overnight parking to camper vans, motorhomes in no overnight parking areas
attributes.background: Lift restrictions to allow a limited number of parking spaces for overnight/domestic use to campervan, motorhome and vehicle dwellers in no overnight/domestic use parking locations around the UK. Increasing tourism and access for people to areas of interest.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has a large base of people that enjoy travelling and visiting areas of interest, coastal and inland areas are increasingly becoming non accessible for people that enjoy being in nature. Height restrictions, width restrictions and signs stating no overnight parking, cooking or domestic activity in vehicles are destroying our access to the UK and reducing tourism. Its causing a "bunching" of such vehicles in areas that are still accessible compounding the problem more.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for landowners and local authorities.

attributes.action: Recognition of natural post-Covid19 immunity as vaccines exemption
attributes.background: Natural immunity is how humanity survived and adapted to the environment over millennia. Its efficacy, durability and adaptability is the gold standard to which pharmaceuticals aim to compare with. Historically, NO treatment is offered to a person AFTER they recovered from their illness.
attributes.additional_details:
By signing this petition:
1. we expect that the decision-makers acknowledge, following a thorough scientific review, the naturally acquired Covid19 immunity of an increasing percentage of the population thus freeing ourselves from needless waves of restrictions 
2. we say NO green pass is required because people are immune either naturally (everyone will meet with the virus eventually) or through vaccination

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600576

attributes.action: Include positive antibody test results for unvaccinated on Covid Passports
attributes.background: Provide free antibody tests to ALL that have recovered from covid and allow that data to be a valid reason to travel and attend domestic events through the covid passport.
attributes.additional_details: Natural immunity has been proven to be more effective and longer lasting than vaccine immunity. If the governments aim is to protect the vulnerable, then the unvaccinated and naturally immune pose no threat to public safety and as such should be prioritised on Covid Passports

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, making a similar request, which you might like to sign:

Recognise immune response to Covid-19 in the Covid pass: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600576

attributes.action: Save AONB Wealden from overdevelopment.
attributes.background: To prevent overdevelopment, specifically in Wealden, an area of natural beauty. Wealden residents have and are facing an extortionate amount of large housing developments. Wealden District Council has failed to provide a 5 year housing plan and now Developers are able to use this to their advantage
attributes.additional_details:
In the last 3 years my village has seen a growth in housing developments, which currently has increased the number of homes by
50%. The village has no street lights, a small oversubscribed doctors surgery, limited public transport that does not run in the evenings or weekends and a small oversubscribed primary school. Due to the incompetence of our local authority in now producing a 5 year plan, us residents are now at the mercy of developers who use this loophole to line their pockets.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local planning decisions are a matter for local planning authorities, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Climate change to be a subject in School because it is a critical issue.
attributes.background: We only have one planet and looking at the critical nature of the environment, it is important that children from Primary Start learning about the environment at a very young age.
attributes.additional_details: We are 8 years old triplets who learned about recycling in school. We started litter picking at age 6. We volunteer at our local council and we have since inspired many children of our age. We are pleading for climate change to be a subject in school.

rejection.details:
Make ‘Environmental Education’ a compulsory separate subject in all schools.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597233

attributes.action: Recognise natural immunity for covid 19
attributes.background: Recognise natural antibody’s for covid and give free antibody tests
attributes.additional_details: Natural immunity has always been far superior to vaccinations . Why should a person be forced to have a vaccination they do not need

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want "natural immunity" to Covid-19 recognised, but we're not sure what you mean by "natural immunity", or how you want this to be recognised.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling on the Government to fund free antibody tests, and extend rules relating to people who are fully vaccinated to people who test positive for Covid-19 antibodies.

attributes.action: Make Sir David Attenborough a Lord !
attributes.background: Give Sir David Attenborough a Lord title, he deserves the title for what he has done for nature, animals and the world.!
attributes.additional_details: Sir David Attenborough is a Legend

rejection.details: You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour at http://www.gov.uk/honours

attributes.action: Prevent children been given covid injection in school without parental consent
attributes.background:
Schools are scheduling children's covid vaccinations without parental consent. 
The covid vacinne was created in under a year. A vaccine has never been developed this quickly and with no liability. The mumps vaccine was the second fasted vaccine to be rolled out and this took 4 years to develop.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to reconsider the long term damage vaccinations could have on our children. No school should be allowed to vaccinate a child under 16 without the consent of the parent.

Children have a natural active immune system and scientific studies have already proven children can adapt and evade covid and other strands of SARS without medical intervention. 
The mass evidence showing deaths and adverse reactions can be seen on the government covid yellow card.
LEAVE OUR CHILDREN ALONE!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand you would like for all children to require parental consent for vaccinations however all children under 12 do currently require parental consent for vaccinations. Those aged between 12 and 16 do also require parental consent but if the consent is not given there is an option for those children to prove what is called "Gillick Competency" and receive a vaccine without the consent of their parents. Those between the ages of 16 and 18 don't need parental consent as they are deemed able to consent as per Family Law Reform Act 1969.

You can read more about the different levels of consent for vaccinations here:
https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/138296/dh_103653__1_.pdf
And you can read more about the Family Law Reform Act 1969 here:
https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1969/46

You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action:

Do not vaccinate children against COVID-19 until Phase 3 trials are complete
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586017

attributes.action: Amend the Coronavirus Act 2020
attributes.background: Allow individuals with Covid neutralizing antibodies and T-cells (or neutralizing antibodies and T-cells in the context of other diseases) developed through natural infection to be afforded equal status to those individuals who have developed immunity by vaccination.
attributes.additional_details: This action will allow individuals who object under the auspices of an Act of Parliament in the UK, or under English Law to being vaccinated, for any reason - e.g. infringement of their rights protected elsewhere under the law or on medical, religious, moral, philosophical or other grounds - to be treated in the same way as individuals who have freely chosen to be vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus, or any other disease.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/580974

attributes.action: Make more Cannabis Oils available on prescription on the NHS for seizure control
attributes.background: We want the government or Parliament to make more Medical Cannabis Oils available , and on the NHS, not just from a specialist doctor or panel so that they can provide a better quality of life and reduce and/or control seizures where many prescription anti epileptic drugs (AEDs) fail
attributes.additional_details:
Since Medical Cannabis Oil being legalised in 2018 there has only been a handful of children prescribed it in the Uk, with hundreds having to go private and self fund.
This isnt some "recreational drug" its a life saving treatment that parents are using to control and reduce their childs seizure activity.
As someone who has had Epilepsy for 36 years I know the effect of living with the condition,so anything more natural that gives a better quality of life is never a bad thing

rejection.details:
This is a decision for the MHRA.

You might like to sign this petition

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584964

attributes.action: To give the honey bee the same protection as bumble bees.
attributes.background: To afford to give honey bee swarms the same protection as the bumble bee and their nests
attributes.additional_details: To stop so many migrating hives being took by bee keepers and moved to other sites. By keep moving these swarms effects the migration pattern of these hives, which follow the local flora blooms. This in the long term effects the natural balance of flora and fauna. Leaving these swarms alone will also stop man spreading diseases agmonst the populations also.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

Your petition calls for honey bees to be given the same protections as bumble bees, but there are no specific legal protections for bumble bees that could be extended to honey bees.

If there are specific protections you want to be introduced for honey bees you could start a new petition explaining clearly what protections you would like the Government or Parliament to introduce. For example, you could call for honey bees to be made a protected species, or for the Government to review existing protections for honey bee populations and habitats.

attributes.action: End period poverty by making all sanitary products in England to free.
attributes.background: The average women spends £13 on period supplies a month. For example £8 on new underwear, £2 on pain relief and £3 on sanitary pads. This adds up to £306 a year. It’s a natural process that we cannot help and it being so expensive to feel sanitary is so upsetting.
attributes.additional_details: Period poverty is a real thing with thousands of women suffering daily. Scotland have made all sanitary products free, and i believe we should follow in their footsteps. If this isn’t possible, i would like for period products to be at least more accessible. I hope you agree and spend just a few minutes of your day to sign this petition and help make change for the better.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584711

attributes.action: Mandatory sexual harassment training for school staff
attributes.background: The Government should require school staff to be trained in how to tackle sexual harassment, so that they can properly safeguard young women, and deal with unacceptable behaviour. I have witnessed sexual harassment in schools, but school staff have failed to take adequate action.
attributes.additional_details: The BBC have reported that some young women have received messages of a sexual nature from up to 11 different people in one night, and that 9 in 10 young women have experienced sexist name-calling or were sent explicit photos or videos. Staff should be trained to recognise and challenge these comments, as many members of staff do not know how to communicate with students about this issue. Sexual harassment is degrading and humiliating, and young women should not have to deal with it in school.

attributes.action: Allow full public scrutiny of DCMS Public Service Broadcasting Advisory Panel
attributes.background: We want transparency for the SoS DDCMS Public Service Broadcasting Advisory Panel. We want to know how its members were selected, copies of the agendas of any panel meetings, the names of any organisation(s) or individual(s) that have presented to the panel and the nature of the presentation(s) made
attributes.additional_details: The British public service broadcasting system is unique. Between them the BBC, ITV, C4 and C5 promote quality, diversity, innovation, respectful debate, and trust, as well as pan-UK production and portrayal. It underpins the ways in which we as individuals, as nations and regions, relate to each other and to the world. Its independence from government and its commitment to impartiality serve everyone. Any debate over its future needs openness to secure the broad public trust and support.

attributes.action: Make it a crime for developers to clear habitat prior planning permission
attributes.background: Make it a crime for developers to evade current laws protecting rare species and breeding wildlife. They clear land prior to asking for planning permission. So nothing for biodiversity officer to see as it is already dead.
attributes.additional_details: I just watched helpless while an area of wasteland, taken by nature for over 10 yrs was bulldozed to oblivion. A fox den with young Cubs, a good population of hedgehogs who would not have escaped. Hedges full of nests, nests, wildflowers. W rang police wildlife officer and Derbyshire wildlife biodiversity officer. By the time we got them it was too late. They were heartbroken and say it happens all the time. Netting is also an issue, destroying swallows nests, bat roosts. All to avoid inspection.

attributes.action: Make "Flying Ant Day" an official Bank Holiday in the UK.
attributes.background: Every summer a wonderful spectacle of nature takes place from within the patios, driveways and other areas ants have toiled to create their nests. Recognising this magical day as an official Bank Holiday will allow families of hard working Brits to come together and enjoy this special event.
attributes.additional_details:
Workers in England and Wales get eight bank holidays a year, fewer than any other European Union country and lagging far behind the bloc’s average. Flying Ant Day will be a step closer to equality with our Continental Cousins. Also this will bring people together outdoors getting fresh air and exercise intern helping with people their mental health.

Flying Ant Day will be decided by the first sighting of a flying ant in this British summer and will take that day going forth.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Make all operations in the countryside accountable to wildlife legislation
attributes.background:
Many operations in the countryside are accountable to the Wildlife and countryside act, or similar regulations.
Developers need to prove that they have taken measures to protect wildlife by law but the same accountability does not seem to apply to other operations ie forestry/agriculture.
attributes.additional_details:
A response to a recent enquiry into forestry operations by a company made very apparent that safeguards to follow wildlife legislation were not followed.
Forestry/agriculture/film locations etc can impact wildlife, often protected wildlife. Evidence must be given that they have taken measures to prevent this. Wildlife law accounts to all, it is not a wish list. If any operation has the potential to impact wildlife, ecological surveys/mitigation must be proven to Natural England.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  It's already the case that people, including developers, need to follow the law. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as creating new laws or establishing new enforcement.

attributes.action: leave our green spaces alone/ stop development on every green space in towns
attributes.background: stop pressuring council’s to build more homes and develop on the little green spaces we have left when they are clearly not needed, once there are enough homes and recourses in a town then to enforce plans for green spaces to be left alone. Some towns have built so many houses with little resources
attributes.additional_details: The current covid-19 pandemic has highlighted how important green spaces are for mental health. Government is putting pressure on council’s to build build build without little thought to the people who live in those towns needing green space for walking in, exercise, family and recreation time and mental wellbeing. not mention the animals & nature that are being pushed out of their natural habitat. enforce councils to leave a significant amount of green space for residents to enjoy in hard times

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about building on greenfield land. However, we're not sure what you are referring to when you refer to the Government 'pressurising councils'. If there was a specific change to planning law that you wanted the Government to make in order to protect greenfield land, then you could start a petition about that.

In the meantime, you might like to sign this petition which calls for a related action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575169

attributes.action: Ban the extraction and use of peat in the UK
attributes.background:
Peat grows so slowly that it's essentially non-renewable.

It's a really important carbon sink, but it's used as heating fuel, which produces pollution and CO2.

It's used in gardening, but renewable and byproduct alternatives are available.

Outlaw peat extraction and use in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
When the selling and burning of wet wood is outlawed, as happened in England recently, people switch to burning peat among other things: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/sep/27/pollutionwatch-wood-and-peat-burning-brings-return-of-air-pollution-to-dublin

Peatlands are the largest natural terrestrial carbon store, and damaged peatlands are a major source of greenhouse gas emissions: https://www.iucn.org/resources/issues-briefs/peatlands-and-climate-change

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Ban the use of peat in horticulture and all growing media by 2023.

Ban all extraction of peat for horticulture by 2022.
